column1: Solapur is a tier-two city in the south-east of Maharashtra, and the administrative headquarters of Solapur district. It shares a border with
Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh, and has therefore attracted a large migrant population from across southern India. Solapur is recorded to have
the highest number of sugar factories in India, and also leads in ‘beedi’ production within the state. The city used to be an important centre for
cotton textile manufacturing until recently and was the first to set up a waste-to-energy electricity plant in Maharashtra. Solapur is well connected
by road to other important cities in the country and has a basic airport that mostly remains unused at present.

4. Political Profile: Leadership and Administrative Structure
Architecture of GovernanceStructure of Elected and Executive Bodies. Giveindication of hierarchies
column2:
Solapur city is governed by Solapur Municipal Corporation. The Corporation is
headed by city Mayor who presides over the deputy Mayor and Corporators
elected from each ward. The administrative wing is headed by Municipal
Councilor. According to Cesus 2011, Solapur Municipal Corporation is divided
into 98 wards.
The important functions of the Solapur Municipal Corporation are assessment
and collection of property tax, birth and death registration, building of municipal
schools and primary health centres etc.
The Maharashtra State has an independent Town Planning and Valuation
department under the administrative control of the Urban Development and
Public Health and Housing Department. It deals with important subjects of town
planning and valuation of real properties. A branch office of the department under
the control of the Town Planner was created in Solapur in 1960. In preparation of
Master Plan and Development Plan of the city, Solapur Municipal Corporation
also plays a significant role under the provisions of the Maharashtra Regional and
Town Planning Act, 1966.
The Pune Housing and Area Development Board, a regional unit of MHADA,
holding territorial jurisdiction over 5 Districts in Pune Division namely; Pune,
Kolhapur, Solapur, Satara, Sangli. It also implements govt. programme of
providing housing under Lok Awas Yojana, VAMBAY Yojana, NSDP Yojana,
IHSDP Yojana, BSUP Yojana, RGGNY Part- I & Part- II Yojana.
Maharashtra Jeevan Pradhikaran (Water Supply and Sanitation Department of
Maharashtra) is responsible for water supply and sewerage facilities in Solapur.
Mr. Devendra Fadnavis from Bharatiya Janata Party is the Chief Minister of
Maharashtra . He was elected on 31-Oct 2014. The Commissioner is Mr. Vijay
